thread.title: Bryant Park skating rink shooter sentenced to 25-years in prison

author: ELLEN MOYNIHAN, LARRY McSHANE
title: Bryant Park skating rink shooter sentenced to 25-years in prison
text:
NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Friday, February 17, 2017, 5:38 PM 
The grinning gunman who left a 14-year-old boy paralyzed and wounded a second man in a botched 2013 robbery at the Bryant Park ice rink received a 25-year jail term Friday. 
Corey Dunton, 19, was sentenced on his convictions in the shootings of Adonis Mera and ice skater Javier Contreras at the Midtown holiday attraction. 
The gunfire sent more than 200 panicked people scrambling for safety. 
Contreras, shot four times as Dunton tried to to steal his $600 Marmot Mammoth parka, survived but has since turned suicidal, suffers panic attacks and fears sleeping in the dark, his mother wrote in a victim’s impact statement. 
Bronx teen convicted in 2013 Bryant Park rink shooting 
“Amazingly so, he was the lucky one,” said Assistant District Attorney James Lin before mentioning Mera — who remains confined to a wheelchair, unable to walk for more than three years. 
“His lifespan has been shortened ... he has trouble dealing with the day-to-day issues of living,” said Lin. “These two victims have suffered greatly because of the actions of this man.” 
Dunton made made headlines after his arrest in the double shooting by flashing an ear to ear grin. He was convicted Jan. 25 of for attempted murder, criminal possession of a weapon, assault and reckless endangerment. Adonis Mera, 17, is paralyzed after being shot at in Bryant Park skating rink three years ago.
